SEARCH

Class TripPoint

java.lang.Object
TripPoint
public class TripPoint extends Object
Has multiple setters and getters to manipulate the private fields. Reads trip.csv files to then calculate haversine distances. Added two different ways to detect stops and creates a new movingTrip array.
Version:
1.1
Author:
Bryan Ho

      doubles are mutable, this getter returns a copy to maintain encapsulation.
      Returns:
      --> gives back a copy of longitude

    • getTrip

      public static ArrayList<TripPoint> getTrip()
      Creates a copy of the trip array to maintain encapsulation, no memory addresses are given away by calling this method.
      Returns:
      -> gives back a copy of the trip

    • getMovingTrip

      public static ArrayList<TripPoint> getMovingTrip()
      Creates a copy of the movingTrip array to maintain encapsulation, no memory addresses are given away by calling this method.
      Returns:
      -> gives back a copy of the movingTrip

    • haversineDistance

      public static double haversineDistance(TripPoint a, TripPoint b)
      Uses TripPoints to pull out lon and lat. Then converts from degrees to radians, then inputs them into the haversine distance formula.
      Returns:
      --> gives back the arc distance in km

    • avgSpeed

      public static double avgSpeed(TripPoint a, TripPoint b)
      Calculates the average speed using distance/time in hours. Uses Math.abs to work in any TripPoint order.
      Parameters:
      a - --> any TripPoint
      b - --> any TripPoint
      Returns:
      --> gives back the avgspeed in km/hr

    • avgMovingSpeed

      public static double avgMovingSpeed()
      Calculates the average moving speed by calculating the total moving distance first.
      Returns:
      --> average speed while moving as a double in km/hr

    • totalTime

      public static double totalTime()
      totalTime() adds all the numbers up from the trip and divides by 60.0 to return a proper double for the total time.
      Returns:
      --> total time as a double

    • movingTime

      public static double movingTime()
      Calculates the total moving time.
      Returns:
      --> the time spent moving as a double

    • stoppedTime

      public static double stoppedTime()
      Calculates the total stopped time by taking the difference between tripTime and movingTime
      Returns:
      --> time spent stopped as a double

    • totalDistance

      public static double totalDistance()
      Loops through the trip to get all points, then calls haversineD to get all the distances, then finally rounds at the end
      Returns:
      --> gives back the properly rounded total distance

    • readFile

      public static void readFile(String filename)
      This method is what creates the actual "trip" ArrayList. First it reads the file, then it will assign the values to the correct variables for the class by calling the TripPoint() method. parsedTime --> Extracted time from the file reader parsedLat --> Extracted Latitude from the file reader parsedLon --> Extracted Longitude from the file reader
      Parameters:
      filename - --> name of the file being read "triplog.csv"

    • h1StopDetection

      public static int h1StopDetection()
      Detects stops using method h1 by checking the distance between each point in the trip array. Then uses a 0.6km (inclusive) threshold to filter out stops.
      Returns:
      --> number of stops using the h1 method

    • h2StopDetection

      public static int h2StopDetection()
      Detects stops using method h2 by creating a streak of stops array. If that array reaches 3 stops or more, the points in the array are not added to the movingTrip. If the streak is broken before 3, then all points in the array are added.
      Returns:
      --> number of stops using the h2 method

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
